Field Detail

nullRoad

public static Road nullRoad
The null road represents Road objects that do not actually exist, preventing NullPointerExceptions. This is necessary for routes that include transport networks as these wont necessarily have a Road object associated with them (e.g. train lines).

Constructor Detail

Road

public Road()
Method Detail

public void initialise()
                throws NoIdentifierException
This should be called once this Road object has been created to perform some extra initialisation (e.g. setting the accessibility methods available to this Road).

Throws:
NoIdentifierException

setAccess

public void setAccess(java.lang.String access)
Sets the access methods which can be used to get down this road (e.g. "walk", "car" etc).

Different roads can be accessed differently depending on the transportation available to the agents. The 'access' variable can be used by ShapefileLoader to set the different accessibility methods, but it must be parsed and the accessibility list populated in initialise() (once the Road has been created). E.g. the String "walk car" indicates agents can either walk or drive down the Road. Note that, ultimately, Roads might also form parts of transport networks (e.g. busses) but this is done by changing the edges in the roadNetwork directly (in EnvironmentFactory.createTransportNetworks) and does not affect Road objects.

Parameters:
access - A string indicating how this road can be traversed, separated by spaces.

getIdentifier

public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
                               throws NoIdentifierException
Get the unique identifier for this Road. This identifier is used to link road features in a GIS with Edges added to the RoadNetwork (a repast Network Projection).

Returns:
the identifier for this Road.
Throws:
NoIdentifierException - if the identifier has not been set correctly. This might occur if the roads are not initialised correctly (e.g. there is no attribute called 'identifier' present in the shapefile used to create this Road).

setIdentifier

public void setIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
                   throws DuplicateRoadException
Set the road's identifier. Will check that it is unique.

Parameters:
identifier -
Throws:
DuplicateRoadException - If a road with the given identifier has already been created
